title: What are the 5 most abundant elements on earth, and what is the percentage in mass? - Quora

response.answer_text: The mass of the Earth is approximately 5.98×10^24 kg. In bulk, by mass, it is composed mostly of iron(32.1%), oxygen (30.1%), silicon (15.1%),magnesium (13.9%), sulfur (2.9%), nickel (1.8%),calcium (1.5%), and aluminium (1.4%); with the remaining 1.2% consisting of trace amounts of other elements. https://www.google.com/search?q=elemental+abundance+in+earth&rlz=1C1CHBF_enUS720US720&oq=elemental+abundance+in+earth&aqs=chrome..69i57j0l5.9263j0j7&sourceid=chrome&ie=UTF-8
